answers.answer:
The [Stakers Union](https://www.stakersunion.com/) is a collective of solo-stakers running Ethereum validators - mostly from home. We are passionate about the security and decentralization of the network and are arguably among the most important contributors to maintaining Ethereum's infrastructure and credible neutrality.

* **Membership:** We have over 130 members who have completed our robust, multi-step verification process.
* **Staker Community:** We have built a vibrant community of like-minded, Ethereum-aligned individuals looking to continue to promote validator diversity.
* **Ecosystem Participation:** Union members actively vote in governance, contribute to protocol discussions, and test infrastructure improvements and coordinate a unified voice for the expression of solo-staker interests.
answers.question: How does your project contribute significantly to the Ethereum network's infrastructure? Please provide specific examples and metrics if available.

answers.answer:
The Stakers Union, in addition to being a conceptually novel organization of solo-stakers, has developed a [unique process](https://docs.stakersunion.com/membership/verification) for member verification - ensuring that only independent operators are eligible for membership. Our dedication to building this collective of solo-stakers has resulted in encouraging partnerships with key ecosystem participants including [Obol](https://obol.org/) (which began by having Stakers Union members operating testnet distributed validators). In addition, our verification process was deemed sufficiently reliable by [StakeCat](https://www.stakecat.space/solo-stakers), a central organization in the independent operator space (responsible for distribution of solo-staker lists) to allow Stakers Union verified members to be included in future lists if not already captured by their existing heuristics.

Our novel verification process includes three key elements:
- **Proof of Eligibility:** Prospective members sign an oath from an eligible address (an address listed on StakeCat’s list of solo-stakers) or can submit an appeal for eligibility which is proposed to verified members.
- **Proof of Independent Operation:** Prospective members demonstrate validator ownership by temporarily disabling attestations during an assigned window - proving validator access and independent operation.
- **Proof of Residential Operation:** Members can optionally demonstrate home operation by submitting a timestamped photo of their node (with metadata stripped to preserve privacy).

This approach offers private identity with public legitimacy, allowing members to remain pseudonymous while proving their validator participation.
answers.question: Describe any pioneering development work in your project, particularly in enhancing privacy, interoperability, or user experience.

answers.answer:
The Stakers Union is directly aimed at addressing the growing centralization of Ethereum’s validator set, driven by large staking-as-a-service providers. While these solutions offer partial decentralization, they still rely on pooled infrastructure and can lead to validator clustering. The ease-of-use of these solutions as well as other benefits including the availability of high-utility liquid staking tokens reduces the incentives for independent operation. While Stakers Union members have pledged their commitment to the Ethereum network - it is plausible that new entrants may be deterred from solo-staking when alternative solutions like liquid staking are easier, offer higher-rewards and require less individual effort.

By design, the Ethereum network cannot detect higher-utility solo- and home-stakers from centralized operators. As a result and to encourage continued and new solo-stakers, the Stakers Union aims to secure out-of-network incentives to provide augmented, long-term incentives for continued solo-staking, including through public funding processes.
answers.question: What specific problems or challenges in the Ethereum ecosystem does your project address? How does your solution improve upon existing alternatives?

answers.answer:
The Stakers Union has outlined a Roadmap for 2025 with key objectives including:
* Promote additional membership applications, incorporate and use analytics to identify successful marketing methods
* Schedule regular community calls (monthly) for progress updates and member feedback
* Complete Gitcoin Passport integration to reduce membership Sybil risk
* Apply to a minimum of 3 public goods funding rounds, gathering feedback on submitted proposals
* Expand existing partnerships to identify opportunities for additional rewards for verified members (ex. Obol Collective proposed partnership with Ether.fi  Operation Solo Staker)
* Participate actively in Ethereum ecosystem discussions (ex. Stakers Union representative in All Core Developers calls)
* Continue to seek applicants for unfilled positions (chairperson, Grants) and reappoint or seek new applicants for filled positions

Read more: https://docs.stakersunion.com/roadmap

The Stakers Union has and will continue to be developed by dedicated solo-stakers who have agreed to contribute their time and effort to these worthy goals. As a result, funding contributions are directed evenly to verified members through a Splits contract - incentivizing the diversity and longevity of Ethereum solo-staking.
answers.question: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.

answers.answer:
The Stakers Union directly incentivizes the growth and retention of solo-stakers, which are arguably the most crucial contributors to a truly decentralized, secure and censorship-resistant Ethereum. By verifying, supporting, and organizing solo-stakers, we: 

- Distribute validator power away from centralized entities
- Encourage client and geographic diversity 
- Ensure more independent actors participate in Ethereum’s consensus layer Improve long-term security by broadening Ethereum’s validator base

No other project focuses as directly or effectively on organizing and rewarding independent stakers at scale.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the decentralization and security of the Ethereum network?

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]—for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Stakers Union
project.description:
Stakers Union
We are a collective of solo-stakers focused on preserving the health and decentralization of the Ethereum network.

The Problem
Incentives for solo-stakers are dwindling. Liquid staking and restaking protocols and their associated liquid tokens drive many away from solo-staking.

The Solution
We are building a collective of avid and passionate solo-stakers to support their activities by securing stable incentives from ecosystem participants.

Current Progress
We have defined defined a robust, multi-step verification process and have over 130 verified members. Our members and other interested participants are active in our Discord where we explore staking-related topics and advocate for solo-stakers.
